text:
This hotels staff and management were so attentive and friendly.
My husband celebrated a significant birthday while we were here and they went out of their way to make it special.
The pool and beach are magnificent and facilities as well
2 restaurants on site, one serving fresh seafood with the biggest prawns I've ever seen!
The spa has an ayervedic doctor on site and massage was fab.
Highly recommend staying here especially at this time as we often had the beach to ourselves

placeInfo: {'id': '2258020', 'name': 'Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2020, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.927604, 'longitude': 81.56074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d2258020-Reviews-Maalu_Maalu_Resort_Spa-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themeresorts.com/maalumaalu/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 320, 'count5': 1543}}
roomTip: Apparently August it was rammed-busy. We were there mid September and it was about 1/4 full .. very nice!
text:
First impressions are great with most things and the first impressions for Maalu Maluu are no exception. 

Check in was quite quick and we were told the usual timings of everything and where everything is. 

On stepping out from check-in you get the first view of the place - which is stunning. The huge infinity pool, stretching to the beach and the ocean, with palm trees either side it brings a smile to your face. As you walk from the boardwalk to you room through the - quite sharp - sand and shells, that smile stays with you when you check into the quirky-nice cool room and large bed. It was quite surprising to see the bathroom is beyond the bedroom and not air conditioned - which is a bit of a shame in 34C - but the shower is huge and the double sinks a bonus too. Also, after a couple of nights you realise that all glass is frosted on all windows in the bedroom and bathroom, so the only way to see outside is to go outside. 

The pool is large with warm water and very inviting. We swam in it at least 3 time a day. My other half also likes to swim in the sea, which was also good here. She loved the beach and the fact you have a perfectly unspoilt view of the horizon. The waves sounded rougher than they were, but the sound of these was very relaxing. 

Service from the pool/beach bar was pretty good. Lion Beer you can’t go wrong with, tried a few cocktails and they were strong, although some tasted like they may use flavoured syrup for some of the cocktail tastes. However, the Maalu Maalu (arack, raspberry, passion fruit, lime) was always excellent and my cocktail of the stay. 

The food from White Sands seafood “shack” was pleasant although didn’t change every day as we had hoped with different fish being caught and used. 

The first night we ate at White Sands and we have simple grilled Mahi Mahi and Grilled Prawns, both came with a small side salad and French fried. Nice enough, but nothing about the dishes screamed Sri Lanka. 

The second night we ate off the a-la-carte menu in the main restaurant, and both ordered crab.  The sauces were great, but Asian crab is very different to our cold water crab. Very little meat and quite an effort to get any out of the sharp shell. Not sure if we should have been given “picks” or not, but it was just too much effort. Glad we tried it, but certainly won’t try again. 

Third night we went back to White Sands and decided to go “reduced budget”. My other half had the chicken burger and I (breaking one of my travel rules!) chose the seafood pizza. Both dishes were pretty underwhelming. The chicken was a basic small piece of grilled chicken in a bun, with the usual side salad and fries. The pizza … we get better frozen pizza in the UK. Both dishes looked like they were from the children’s menu.  I need to stick to my rule of only eating pizza in Italy, the UK and the USA. 

Breakfast was the usual buffet. A nice selection of fruit. Some cold meats and cheese. A weird selection of western-style breakfast choices like hash-browns and baked beans. The occasional small slice of quiche. Boiled eggs. And sausages made of either beef, chicken or pork (which surprised me - but I tried and they were like UK Richmond sausages) - that sort of thing. 

However, the small Sri Lankan breakfast choice was very tasty, and the “egg station” did dosai and .. of course .. hoppers. We LOVE hoppers for breakfast, and the lovely little lady making them did a superb job. 

A special shout out to Anusanger (probably spelt that wrong - but that’s another bit of feedback … please give all the team members name badges!  I would prefer to use their name rather than “mate”, “sir”, “young lady”, “fella” … and all the other things one calls someone if you don’t know they name).  He was always there and looking after us … as we’re all the great team there - and that’s another huge positive. Everyone was so nice and friendly, well trained and attentive. 
It was also lovely to meet the “animator” on the last day .. didn’t get his name (badges!) .. but he was very friendly and informative. 

In summary - if you love the beach, a wonderful pool, nice drinks and more western-style food … Maalu Maalu should be on your list of places to stay at. It’s like a day beach club (good for families too) … which doesn’t quite deliver for adults in the evening, and lacks a little with choice for authentic Sri Lankan food.
title: Very good .. worth a visit

text: Simply the best. The venue is gorgeous, clean and just perfect beach and infinity pool. Rooms excellent but what makes this place is the staff. All of them are courteous, polite and get the job done. Ashok Kumar has trained them well. The food was incredible in variety and quality. We used the spa and I have to say Asanga gave the best massage ever. Relaxing and sorted all the knots. Probably because he has a physio background. Well worth the money which actually was very reasonable for the experience. Lots and lots to do locally from wild life, ancient monuments to besch fun, boat rides and watersports. We will be back!
title: Pasikudah heaven

text: We have just returned from Maalu Maalu and it was truly exceptional!! The location, pool, beach, staff and more were amazing and I have to say this is probably one of the best hotel locations I have stayed in and there have been many... the rooms were also stunning and the views were to die for. I specifically wanted to mention Ruben who assisted with everything around the pool and beach and was super friendly and very efficient. text:
After travelling around Sri Lanka for a week our 4 night stay at Maalu Maalu was just the relaxation we were looking for. A stunning beautiful hotel, our interconnecting rooms about 20 paces to our sunbeds  where Reuben looked after us beautifully! Sumptuous food, yoga on the beach, snorkelling and lazy beach/pool days. 
A real find, pure paradise and a deserted beach all to yourself. Highly recommend!!!!!
title: Just paradise

text:
We came  from the Amaya hotel for lunch . Very attentive , friendly service from the waiter at the beach bar . We ordered a club sandwich , seafood pizza  and drinks all very reasonable . Quick service too !! My only comment would be about the pizza which was underwhelming. I wondered if the pizza base was freshly baked. The topping also was sparse in the seafood topping 
This is undoubtedly a very classy resort which was evident from the surroundings .
I would come again and stay  next time
title: Really nice location and hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '2258020', 'name': 'Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2020, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.927604, 'longitude': 81.56074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d2258020-Reviews-Maalu_Maalu_Resort_Spa-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themeresorts.com/maalumaalu/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 320, 'count5': 1543}}
text:
There is no doubt that Maalu Maalu is a 5* experience. The staff are very attentive, they can’t do enough to make your experience better. The food compared to other high end hotels in Sri Lanka is of superb quality, especially the beachfront restaurant and surf and turf dining experience on the beach.

Me and my partner both made use of the spa (a few times), compared to other places in the world we felt the experience we received was good value for money, with the staff being professional and experienced, providing an impecable experience. A special shoutout to Asanga, he restored my faith with his high standard of massages.
title: Luxury 2 night stay - excellent service, food and spa experience

placeInfo: {'id': '2258020', 'name': 'Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2020, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.927604, 'longitude': 81.56074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d2258020-Reviews-Maalu_Maalu_Resort_Spa-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themeresorts.com/maalumaalu/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 320, 'count5': 1543}}
text:
After two weeks travelling around Sri Lankan our stay here was a real treat. A totally relaxing place, ideal for our 4 night stay. The resort is beautifully set out around the main pool, over looking the sea.
We stayed in one of the attic rooms with our two teenagers, an amazing space with separate area for the children to sleep. The bathroom was enormous, with two sinks and a huge shower and bath.
Most nights we had a pre dinner drink by the sea watching the beautiful sunset. We then either had the buffet evening meal or chose from the A la carte menu. The buffet was incredible, something for everyone.
Staff were friendly and very efficient.
title: A paradise final stay

text:
What an amazing people, only made better (if that were possible) by the incredibly warm and welcoming staff. The staff make you feel like family, they care for you, always going above and beyond. 
The location, looking out to the Bay of Bengal is breathtaking, and the resort is beautifully styled, authentic and blending naturally with its surroundings. The food is phenomenal, a great mix of local and western delicacies, and a wonderful variety. We have had the most wonderful time at this special spot with these beautiful people.
title: Feels like home

placeInfo: {'id': '2258020', 'name': 'Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2020, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.927604, 'longitude': 81.56074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d2258020-Reviews-Maalu_Maalu_Resort_Spa-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themeresorts.com/maalumaalu/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 320, 'count5': 1543}}
roomTip: Walk the beach and watch the sunset. Just relax and enjoy!
text: Words and photos can’t do it justice - you will not regret booking a stay at Maalu Maalu! One of the most beautiful beaches we’ve seen, almost deserted with warm water and soft sand. An infinity pool that looks like it naturally glides into the see with warm water. The staff were fantastic - everyone when above and beyond - they seem to really enjoy working  there. Reuben the pool guy saved our favourite sun beds every day right by our chalet, Richi (animation) was great with the kids and kept us entertained but wasn’t in our faces like they can be at resorts. Management kept checking on us and checking all ok with a smile. All other staff were just as amazing. The chalets are great - well designed so they all have a view of the pool and sea. The food - we’ve never had better at a resort - a team of 15 chefs prepare the most amazing spread we’ve experienced, tastes like no other and a good balance of local/international food. There were a relatively small number of guests which made it feel intimate/exclusive/peaceful/very special. We can confidently say we have never stayed anywhere better - and maybe won’t. We were really sad to leave even though that wasn’t the end of our holiday as the time here was fantastic!
title: A magnificent gem - this is literally paradise.

text: There’s nothing quite like Maalu Maalu Resort. You come for the palm trees, the warm water, the cold beers on the beach but really what you stay for is the people, you could scour the globe for decades and never come across a more hospitable and more genuine staff. So don’t hesitate, book a stay at Maalu Maalu resort. You’ll leave with more friends than you came with!

text:
We had an amazing stay at this resort, which offers direct beach access. Our room was a charming thatched-roof chalet facing the ocean on the ground floor. It was spacious enough to comfortably fit a king-size bed and a roller bed. The bathroom was impressive with a huge double vanity, although it lacked AC. Each room comes with a personal small pool shared with adjacent rooms.
The room  is conveniently located within walking distance to dining options, the pool, and beach areas. The beach itself was pristine and well-maintained, with beach seats set up early in the morning for sunrise viewing. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, providing a traditional style welcome upon arrival. Reception was fast and efficient throughout our stay.
Overall, we had a delightful experience and felt truly happy during our time here.
title: Delightful Experience !

text: We stayed at Maalu Maalu in the deluxe attic family room. The room was really well maintained and can easily accommodate four people. The bathroom was really spacious and with plenty of ayurvedic toiletries. The beach is magnificent and only about 50m from the room. The staff were very friendly and Roshan took really good care of us and set us up for a snorkeling session with a very reasonable price. The hotel also conducts fee yoga sessions in the morning. The food had a relatively small spread but everything was delicious. Really enjoyed the stay and looking forward to visiting again.
title: Truly a five star experience

text: Stayed 3 nights in connecting rooms (2 adults and 2 teens 17) It’s a beautiful hotel with a wonderful view , both at the pool and sea. Perfect and spacious rooms with large bathrooms. Very good service and wonderful food. The beach is beautiful and still with a lot of untouched land. We went snorkeling, water scootering and we tried the spa. You can also use a gym and library/ game room. And what I really loved (travelled a lot) was that this resort was not bigger than it is, quality over quantity. Breathtaking view. A bit to much crows but the hotel did their best. Thank you for everything, we would love to come back.
title: Just as beautiful as it can be 🌴

placeInfo: {'id': '2258020', 'name': 'Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2020, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.927604, 'longitude': 81.56074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d2258020-Reviews-Maalu_Maalu_Resort_Spa-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themeresorts.com/maalumaalu/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 320, 'count5': 1543}}
text:
The staff at Maalu Maalu is what makes this property so special.  Yes,  the beach and pool are spectacular but the heart of  the resort comes from the staff.  To name a few,  Rubin went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed every day as well as learning our names. He was available without ever bothering us.  Extremely polite and respectful. I am in the hospitality industry and can see great potential in him.  He is friendly,  very smart and eager.  He is manager material. He also leaned English on his own. 
Ruchie the activity coordinator, was also fabulous.  He made great connections with many people and played games and made sure all were having a great time. 
Both assistant managers Ashuk and jabesh checked in at every meal to be sure we were satisfied.  

Also, the environmental considerations are greatly appreciated. Paper straws, real napkins, real silverware and natural soaps and lotions. We were also told the new resort,  jackfruit was built without removing trees.  Amazing!!!

All of the staff had a smile every day.  This resort is a gem and it's primarily due to the heart of the people who work there. 

The food was also fabulous!!! We ate dinner in the boat at the seafood market and it was unbelievable! So delicious. The hoppers made to order were the best we've had a well.  Be sure to have the crab curry if you like spicy food! I'll be back to this wonderful place for sure.  We spent 3 weeks in  Sri Lanka in 6 different places and this was the best!
title: A beautiful location with heart

The Seaview room was so comfortable.

text:
Stayed 2 nights with family. We booked 2 superior rooms however at the check in they updraded us to deluxe FOC. 

Superb hotel with very comfortable spacious rooms. All required amenities were intact. Lovely view from room of the ocean.  

Reception staff very helpful. Many thanks to Kasuni , Priya and Jethu for making us feel like entering to our own home at the check in. 

Restuarant staff was exceptional. Very big thank to Chef Sanjeewa, who personally looked after our meals and our f & b requirements.  Dhammika the steward was very friendly and helpful in many ways. 

Unfortunately there were very little guests due to Easter bomb issue prevailed at that time and they were not able to make us enjoy the buffet but we did not feel any difference as their a la carte is fantastic . 

All in all,  we had a fabulous holiday thank to highly professional and very caring staff of Amaya beach. Thank you so much team and we will definitely visit again to see all of you.
title: Excellent Hospitality

text:
This year, we (my Parents and I) once again decided to stay at AMAYA, Pasikuda for the second time during our proposed outing.

First, I called AMAYA Colombo office to inquire on the best room rates and other facilities available. Mr. Umesh of the call centre provided me all the details I requested from him without leaving a single query unanswered. Upon receiving complete satisfaction on all the information given by Mr. Umesh, I decided to proceed with the booking for which Booking No. 446064687 was allocated to confirm my visit from 06 to 08 Septemb 2024. Our first visit to Amaya, Pasikuda was on 30 April 2023.

Before visiting the hotel, I called Ms. Priya, the Receptionist and requested her to arrange me the room to accommodate three adults. She immediately arranged all my requirements and confirmed. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were accorded a friendly welcome by Ms. Sheronica and provided us the Room No. 5007 on ground floor facing the beach.

Like last time, we were extremely satisfied with our stay from 06 to 08 September 2024 at AMAYA, Pasikuda as we received the best hospitality we expected from an Internationally reputed hotel in Sri Lanka. Accommodation, meals, room service, pool and all other services were extremely excellent.

It is my duty to commend the services rendered by all staff of AMAYA, Pasikuda with a special thanks to Ms. Priya and Ms. Sheronica the receptionists and Mr. Umesh, the call centre agent who I reckon as prefessional hoteliers who could impress and convince all your visitors to stay with AMAYA, Pasikuda. 

I have no hesitation in recommending AMAYA, Pasikuda to all my friends and relatives who plan to visit Pasikuda in the near future and our next visit to the east will definitely be AMAYA, Pasikuda.
title: OUR FAMILY VISIT TO AMAYA, PASIKUDAH FROM 06 TO 08 SEPTEMBER 2024

roomTip: best to walk 100 m to the left to the public beach or 10 minutes walk to Kalkudah Bay/the opposite bay (there is a dream beach there)
text: Very large hotel complex. Modern and large rooms with sea views. The spa area is great (very authentic and professional, OK price-wise). The food was OK (large selection, but unfortunately everything was cold). The beach is nice, but since there is a (dead) reef right in front of it with lots of dead stone corals, you can't swim there (you can't walk there without bathing shoes - risk of injury!!!). Best to walk 100 m to the left to the public beach (there are no stone corals there and swimming is possible) or 10 minutes walk to Kalkudah Bay/the opposite bay (there is a dream beach there)
title: Nice hotel with large rooms and awesome spa

text:
We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our tour and were a bit concerned by recent comments that we had read. We are pleased to report that we found that the issues had been addressed; there was no scum around the pool and no exposed sandbags on the beach.
We had a lovely big room with good a/c and a nice patio leading onto groomed grounds and a nice beach.
All of the staff were absolutely lovely, from the room boy to the pool guys and the restaurant staff.
The buffet and food offerings were excellent.
title: Great setting, lovely staff

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
roomTip: Consider paying more to stay in a better quality hotel
text:
I want to write a really balanced review which draws upon the strengths of the hotel as well its shortcomings 

Strengths 
We had a deluxe sea view - lovely airy room enough for 3 . Spacious bathroom amenities topped up daily . Our room boy Lojanan was great as was maintenance Daaz.
View and sunsets  amazing the hotel is nicely framed by swaying palm trees around the grounds 
Shop was good value - friendly person working there 
We were given an anniversary cake and decorated bed lovely touch 
Overall staff very kind and helpful from restaurant, bar , reception and pool attendants
Hotel clean good evidence lots of maintenance goes on daily .
Laundry service fine 

Negatives
The area outside is rough , dirty rubbish nearby 
The seafood bar  opposite plays music at a ridiculous loud level why ?? 
Whilst the public beach next door didn’t bother us at all , when it was busy there were men hanging about outside hotel  not sure why 
I saw the security guard at the beach drink out of a wine bottle whilst on duty . Even if it was water that should not be happening ! 
The pool hygiene is questionable, I saw a naked toddler in the pool this was ignored 
Crows drinking from the pool . Dirty scum round edge . Questionable chlorine levels. 
Sun bed wars at times you needed to get there before 8.30 am   to get a lounger .
The food!! The quality was inconsistent bones on meat , tough beef. A lot looked the same from previous nights . Saw lots of flies at the outside cooking station some were dead in-between the glass panelling 
I think there was a food  and  beverage  manager walking around , little if any interaction with guests 
Breakfast could be chaotic items not replenished in a timely way . Napkins were at times dirty 
One tourist chose to walk around bare foot at breakfast despite clear etiquette around clothing this was ignored 
Food cold mainly 
Service at honey  beach bar  slow .

In summary
We ate at the Uga  hotel one night and had lunch at Malu Malu  hotel the difference in quality is unmeasurable!
Wished we had trusted our gut and stayed in a high end resort .
title: I wouldn’t come back ! Disappointed with aspects

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
roomTip: The buffet area can be a bit noisy but ask the staff and you can sit outside by the beach, much nicer and you hear the sea.
text:
I loved the brutalist contemporary architecture of this hotel.  It was large, clean with great sized bedrooms.  The beach was lovely, there is a good sized pool, lots seating around the coconut shaded grounds to lie on and watch the great sunsets.

Food at the buffet was to a high standard and the large centrally located bar was a nice place to relax.  We used both the games room and spa and thought they were good.

The sea off the beach has reef which was fun for scuba diving.  If you are just swimming bring your shoes.

If you are looking for a restful beach hotel that looks good this will not disappoint.

There is a public beach next door, they don’t come into the hotel but it makes a fun place to walk over to and see the locals having fun, especially at weekends.
title: Great contemporary beech hotel

text:
We Stayed in this beautiful location for two nights and enjoyed the stay very much .
The Rooms were spacious and clean with view to the beach . Massive pool with great views to the beach and the sea. Adjoining is a pristine clean beach with shallow and calm waters to swim safely . Lifeguards are on duty . 
Restaurants had great Buffet with very good selection .The Hoppers were a favorite among local and foreign guests .Wished he had more burners to turn out more hoppers at once ! 
Reception staff and Manageress on duty were very helpful and kind . 
Overall a great stay at Amaya Beach Pasikudah !

text:
Our recent stay at Amaya Pasikudah was truly fantastic. The overall experience was excellent. The hotel presentation was really good and well-maintained. The rooms were well-cleaned and kept clean. The food was really good, with a good range of choices at the buffet. The outdoor areas were well-kept, and the view was magical. The main bar and lounge were highlights of the hotel, though some music would improve the ambiance. The regular chefs at the action stations tirelessly attended to our food requests.
 
The restaurant hostess,Shashika, went out of her way to be attentive and meet our needs. Additionally, the executive chef, Mohmad, was excellent and looked after our individual food needs. The crab curry they offer is a must-try dish for anyone visiting this amazing hotel. The hotel’s General Manager, Mr Pamunuwa continuously checked on us to ensure our stay was pleasant and enjoyable.
 
Last but not least, our houseman, Sivasanka  is an asset to the hotel. He is very friendly, polite, and exceeded our expectations. We noticed that most of the other frontline staff were very polite but lacked confidence in maintaining a conversation.
 
Overall, we had a pleasant and enjoyable stay and we will surely be back.
title: Our recent Stay

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
roomTip: Go elsewhere if you want a relaxing, cared-for experience.
text:
We are a family of 3 and we should have stayed 4 nights at Amaya Beach. We checked out after 2 and went to Uga Bay which is 3 times the price but a 10 times better experience. I’m very surprised to see so many people calling this place “luxury” or “high end”, it’s really not. The reality does not match their website descriptions or photos. I just found the whole place quite depressing.

First, the positives - our room was excellent. Spacious, loads of room for luggage and storage, effective AC and a nice balcony.

Housekeeping is very efficient and friendly, as are the reception staff. Sadly, we felt that the communal areas, bar staff and some of the food really lets the hotel down. 

Our biggest issue is that we wanted to spend most of our time during this part of our holiday (a 2 week tour of Sri Lanka) in the pool and/or the sea/beach. Both of these areas at Amaya are frankly a disgrace. The pool is filthy, it has a greasy, grimy ring around the whole of the edge and there are living insects (water fleas?) in it. If the proper chlorine levels are applied and cleanliness standards adhered to, there should be no living creatures in a swimming pool! 

The beach has clearly been man made using sand bags made of plastic, which are now eroding away into the ocean, causing devastating pollution of the hotel’s own making. The lack of any attempt or effort to clean the swimming pool and sort out the plastic sandbags on the beach speaks to the general feeling of a lack of care from staff. 

Crows are clearly present all along this part of the coast, however there were far more here than at Uga Bay and would hazard a guess that it’s because they actually clear away dirty plates and glasses there quickly, unlike here! Crows are extremely clever birds and have obviously learned that they can have a feast at Amaya Beach. As someone has said, they are constantly drinking from the pool water and leaving droppings everywhere. 

The service in the bar area is woeful. Dirty glasses and dishes sat for a long time whilst staff watched cricket on tv. See photo attached of dirty glasses that were left in the hotel grounds overnight and for the whole of the next day - several staff walked past these many times. Staff at the bar were unfriendly and lazy. Reactive, never proactive - the onus is on the customer for everything, even getting their own bill. Had to go to bar every time you want something. To have a 10% service charge added to each bill here is an insult.

You have to beg for towels and when we first arrived he said there are “none left”… “you wait 20 mins”. There is a full time pool attendant who not once got sun lounger cushions out - all guests lay on hard rattan sun loungers that were falling apart. We got some cushions from a filthy looking pile by side of hotel - the pool guy came over and said these were old and that if we waited 2 hours the new ones would be ready…well of course they never materialised. Why is the onus on the paying customer to return towels? There were two staff by the towel bin doing literally nothing but kick a ball around.

Dining experience is not great (hot, very busy) and food quality overall is poor. All meat dishes have bones in them - the lamb curry last night even contained liver. Limited choice and some foods incorrectly labelled eg pasta puttanesca was a creamy pasta. Salad and fruit offerings at breakfast were clearly leftovers from night before. The exception was the egg bar at breakfast- the eggs and omelettes were very good. 

I feel bad for the lovely staff who put effort into their jobs here - they are being let down by poor management who quite frankly should be addressing the issues I’ve highlighted. Our tour operator told the management team of our plans to leave early, however when we checked out the following day the reception staff had no idea - they had not been told. The fact that family is checking out early because they are not happy tells you all you need to know about management’s attitude to customer service.
title: All the positives are sadly outweighed by the negatives

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
text:
We had an amazing Family Residence Suite with the most beautiful view! Our housekeeping chap was very helpful and kept the rooms lovely.

Loved sitting at Honey beach early evening with a Ceylonese cocktail watching the sunset.

This is the 4th hotel we stayed in on our trip to Sri Lanka and sadly the worse in terms of food, staff and the pool area.

The staff got friendlier the longer we were there luckily. But for the first few days they were very unfriendly compared to all our other stays. The buffet was manic, at breakfast and dinner - with less choice than previous hotels, things not topped up readily and the majority of dishes luke warm at best. Very disappointing.

The resort got busier and busier into our stay.....then sunbed wars started. There is not enough beds for the number of guests. I did not expect to have to be fighting for a sun bed in Sri Lanka.  The pool isn't great.....very underwhelming, shallow and the ravens are constantly drinking from it and pooping on the edge. Pretty grim!

No mention of a national holiday until we went to the bar and were told no alcohol being served ! Thought they would have at least informed their guests! 

Definitely only 4 star but loved our suite - apart from the child above who constantly ran everywhere sounding like a herd of elephants at all times of the day. After 4 days of putting up with it, Reception tried to help however it didn't improve sadly. 

The beach is lovely, take water shoes and use the public beach for swimming due to coral reefs.
title: Could be brilliant.......

roomTip: Beds near the pool get 'booked up' early- so need to get your towels on the bed early
text:
No issues with the hotel, staff, room or food. Lovely location and friendly staff (except our fridge in Rm 5108 was plainly not working but the maintenance chap insisted it was!).
My only concern is the care of our driver. The hotel provides accommodation for the tour driver on a first come first served basis, Our driver had to stay in a cramped hot room with 2 other driver. No facilities to clean the car for the clients. A hot, small room and he had poor sleep as a result. 
The hotel needs to recognise that drivers play a key and important role in the holiday journey for their clients. A driver not looked after affects the guests the next day- and we have a 5 hour journey to Haputhale this morning to look forward to with a very tired driver.
The hotel undoubtedly was very busy hence makes good profits to be able to care appropriately for the tour drivers.
Hope this feedback is taken into account by hotel management. Or it may lose clients if guests feel their holiday is compromised as the driver is a member of the team looking after your guests.
title: Tour drivers' care

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
text:
A coastal retreat for the weary to disconnect, relax and rewind in refined resort environment.

Imagine tropical coastal sophistication greetings you as you enter the lobby to check-in at your holiday accommodation. The refreshing cool towel and tropical fruit juice provide instant relief from the tropical heat as attentive and friendly staff take care of your luggage and organise your room keys. The frangipani water pool motif reminds you that you are venturing into the coastal tropical paradise of Pasicuda.

The ample palm trees and lush lawn provide natural cooling for guest who want to lounge on outdoor daybeds, while the sounds of the ocean create a relaxing ambient sound that relaxation recordings unceasingly try to replicate. Perfect for those seeking to sun tan, escape into a book or just lay about.

The pool is a balmy, comfortable temperature and at 1.4m able to be enjoyed by all ages. It is large enough to do laps and for people to congregate and chill in the water. For those seeking greater depths the private beach is accessible only a few metres beyond the pool and lawn area. The ocean is refreshing but tropically tempered. 

The grounds and pool staff are welcoming and friendly, smiling and exchanging greetings in various languages and offering assistance moving daybed lounges and towel service. 

The bar and kitchen staff do not skip a beat. They know how to cater for many guests with personalised service. I was grateful to have a few staff remember our drink orders, room numbers and names. The wait staff attentively refill table water and remove plates and cutlery from tables when finished. 

The dining was flavoursome. Some buffet items were not as fresh as others and I found the Seaford  and stir-fry items to be, at times, over cooked and rubbery. The other dishes were satisfactorily prepared. The chefs at the grill were efficient and cooked items perfectly.

The spa provides a sublime masseuse experience for those wanting to indulge in tranquility and amoratics.
The head to toe massage was relaxing and offered a firm utility to leave the participants feeling somewhere between relaxed and remedial. The aromatic oils linger as a reminder of the indulgent pampering only steps away.

Our rooms were clean and comfortable, although with so many facilities and the ambient environment you wont spend much time in your room. The rooms offer refuge for those who need a break from the heat with ducted airconditioning and a ceiling fan providing consistent and comfortable cooling. The tv is a good size and has a selection of cable channels. 

This resort is a 5 Star setting, creating a paradise.
title: Coastal retreat a treat to disconnect and relax.

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
roomTip: Ask for a room at the beach end of the corridor for the best views and access to the beach
text: Beautiful hotel with stunning rooms and a great outlook over the bay. The rooms were very spacious with plenty of room for an extra bed for our children. Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of cuisine although the juice was processed cordial rather than fresh which was a little odd given the abundance of fresh fruit in the area. The dinner buffet was also excellent and great value for money with kids under 10 free and under 16 at half price - it was cheaper to eat here than the local restaurants and the food choice was excellent particularly the freshly cooked meats and bread. Special shout out to the two men cooking outside every night who were very funny and made fun excellent kebabs and roti. The pool was a little underwhelming primarily because it was in the glaring sun with no shade and secondly as it wasn’t filled up properly and so didn’t act as a filtered infinity pool as per the photos. The beach was nice early in the morning and late at night but low tide meant lots of broken coral and poor viability snorkeling - reef shoes were essential. Luckily Manj the pool guy was great and very helpful providing reef shoes and helping with cushions and towels every day in addition to pointing out the best way to catch coconuts! Truly an asset to the resort. The only downside was one night they put on a beach disco which was fine until 10.30 when the poorly mixed thumping music (on loop) was not turned down so the two people on the beach could dance but everyone else was trying to sleep while their windows vibrated. It took multiple calls and escalations in person to resolve - very poor management decision to allow this at an otherwise great hotel.
title: Beautiful hotel and great food - just remember ear plugs for the beach disco!

placeInfo: {'id': '4198494', 'name': 'Amaya Beach - Pasikudah', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1572, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.925548, 'longitude': 81.56807, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d4198494-Reviews-Amaya_Beach_Pasikudah-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.amayaresorts.com/amayabeach/', 'address': 'Pasikuda Rd, Pasikuda Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pasikuda Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 50, 'count2': 56, 'count3': 101, 'count4': 328, 'count5': 1038}}
text:
Amaya Beach, Pasikudah, is a beautiful, beach hotel.

On arrival, the reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. We were settled into our room quickly and efficiently and we were sipping a cocktail before we knew it! (once we’d hunted the bar staff down).  We had a sea view room, with a terrace, which was less than a two minute walk to the beach and our room was huge! (we did upgrade and I really recommend doing so, if you can).

The restaurant staff were friendly and the food was delicious! The bar staff became more friendly over time but for some reason, they were not forthcoming in serving us and we had to keep asking for drinks, rather than being asked if we wanted more. We did find this frustrating at times and rather baffling (did they not want to sell drinks and make tips?).

There is a small shop and an ATM about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel, which was useful but other than that, we didn't venture outside the hotel, so I can't comment on the surroundings (other than to say, there was a huge amount of litter, which we hadn't seen and subsequently didn't see, anywhere else in Sri Lanka).

We stayed at this hotel for four nights, with the aim of reading, swimming and generally relaxing and that is exactly what we did, and Amaya Beach provided the perfect setting.
title: Gorgeous beach views and yummy cocktails

roomTip: The sea just in front of hotel is a bit rocky. Just to the left of hotel, the sea is clearer. Best time for a swim is early in the morning.
text:
The time we spent at Amaya was fascinating. The food was of good variety and very tasty. The room was spacious and clean. We had a nice swim in the sea. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Ms. Priya to whom I spoke to when booking made my reservation paying heed to all my requirements. She made sure everything was ready upon our arrival and we were directed straight to our cosy room the moment we arrived. She even inquired later whether there was anything else we wanted during our stay.
I fully recommend Amaya Passikuda for any family both local or foreign.
title: Peaceful time by the Sea

text:
We had a fabulous weeks  stay at Amaya beach hotel 
The hotel is beautiful,  clean and bright and with excellent facilities including the Olympic size swimming pool and a Spa where I enjoyed a wonderful relaxing aromatic massage.
There are beautiful views of the sea we enjoyed from our sun lounger and the  beach is stunning with soft white sand and a calm and gentle sea as warm as a bath.
This is a perfect retreat to unwind and
 re charge.
The staff are welcoming friendly and kind.particularly the manager and restaurant and bar  staff.
Our room was kept clean and tidy by our friendly cleaner Ajith who looked after us very well and made sure we had a daily supply of water and fresh towels.  
He even took the time to make animals from the towels which made us smile.
We will  definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.
title: Amaya beach heaven

text: We had a memorable stay in Amaya beach. Excellent location to have a beach resort. All the services were arranged customer friendly manner. We had a warm welcome on arrival. placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text:
We are delighted with their extra mile service and the atmosphere of the hotel. From the time of welcoming us they never missed to serve with a warm welcoming smile, staff is attentive. The front office manager Hasini does a great job keeping her team enthusiastic. Also we thank  Thevakumar and Haritha for being available for us. 
Next the food is very tasty, they brilliantly balance the items with a simple buffet. I forgot the name of the chef who cooked a tasteful mutton curry, also Akshika, Ashwin were helpful. 
Rooms are clean and beautiful, entire hotel is well maintained with beautiful gardens we never felt that we are in a beach site. 
Pool is like a heart of the hotel huge and spacious. The pool attendant Mohan does his job well. 
We can enjoy the hotel beach with much privacy. We will visit you again. Thank you and wish you good luck Team Sunrise!
title: Ultimate place with a beach Vibe

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text: The room was cozy and clean, and cleaning was carried out daily. Every morning there was a delicious and hearty breakfast with fresh fruits and juice. I was pleased with the infrastructure of the hotel: a large long clean swimming pool, fitness room, spa, ping pong, billiards. The hotel has its own wide beach. The food in the restaurant is delicious, and the service is at the highest level. On the last day, we had a beautiful farewell dinner by the pool. We recommend the hotel to everyone, we will come back here again.
title: October 2024

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text: You enter this resort through a stunning atrium that presents a view over the impressive pool, through to the ocean. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable, well equipped and quiet. Within the atrium there are comfortable spaces for lounging and dining. We were looked after wonderfully by Dannika and Ashwin, who made sure we had everything we needed - lovely wines and excellent food. We also enjoyed a morning ocean swim and I had a relaxing spa treatment from Tharanga. Thank you also to Mathan for looking after us.
title: Luxury resort on a beautiful beach

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
roomTip: The staff at the reception is very inexperienced and uncooperative, so best to communicate extra details such as rooms close by through mail
text:
Pool is very enjoyable and one of the longest swimming pools i'v seen in Sri Lanka. Very nice rooms with comfortable beds and pillows but with the way the hotel is built, all the rooms face the garden and do not have any ocean view.

But the positivity ends there. The buffet spread is average with very limited variety. But what really stuck out was the staff &the hospitality. The majority of the staff is inexperienced & ill-trained. Specially the girl at the reception really needs more training on how to welcome guests as she works with the attitude of a government worker. When we arrived and i tried to check-in she dismissively signaled with her hand for me to wait and continued with her call. I waited for more than 15 minutes for her to call me back and since she didn't i went back to the reception. Again she told me to wait in a dismissive manner. It felt like being inside a government office trying to get something done from a government officer 🙄
After waiting for more than 30 minutes she finally decided to attend to checking me in (after i reminded her for the 3rd time) but messed it up and charged me more which got sorted only after the front office manager got involved. Till the manager got involved she and the other man at the reception kept arguing with me and trying to prove that the overcharged price was right with various illogical reasons (despite me showing them the email from the hotel mentioning the correct total)

I would not have written this review had I not seen a video of the same girl giving an extravagant welcome to a local youtube influencer couple, when we did not even receive a bare minimum welcome let alone pleasant. Please treat all your guests the same way and not just the youtube influencers. We actually PAY YOU unlike the youtube influencers whom you bow down to. The behavior of your staff does not suit a 4-star hotel
title: Ill-trained staff

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text: This was one wonderful staycation that we have had. It’s a beautiful hotel with a soothing sea view and peaceful atmosphere.Everyone of the staff here were quite helpful and friendly always quick at service. We were welcomed warmly and helped around whenever needed.All our requirements were fulfilled by sunrise paradise and our hearts are full as we say goodbye to this place leaving a promise that we would definitely return to this amazing place and surely would recommend sunrise Pasikudah to anyone.

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text:
Hotel is clean, well maintained and has spacious rooms and all the amenities for the guests. Staff are very kind, friendly, helpful and look after their guests very well.
It has nice big garden area and amazing 100m+ pool that is stretched towards the beach where guests can really swim, relax and enjoy their holiday.
Beach is very clean (white sand, clear water, no plastic or rubbish) and not crowded. You can watch the sunrise which is an amazing experience, walk the along the bay or swim or do other water activities. Mood spa offers variety of treatments. We had the foot massage which was really good.
Overall we had the best beach holiday and definitely will be going there again.
Thanks to the pool attendant who maintains the pool daily...It is crystal clear that you would not want to come out. 
Special thanks to GM,  all the reception, restaurant and room service staff for making our stay an unforgettable holiday.
title: Amazing place to relax and enjoy beach holiday

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text: We had a great stay at the hotel. The pool is really special, the beach at the front has white sand and blue water inviting you to dive in, rooms are beautiful and the staff is extremely nice and looking after your needs. Everything is kept clean as well. For Breakfast you can choose between western and Sri Lankan style which was both very filling and tasty. The restaurant in itself offers good food for fair prices. We felt like the price to value at this hotel is overall very good and we would definitely stay here again!

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text:
We had an unforgettable stay at Sunrise Pasikudah. The service was impeccable and the staff were so kind, attentive, and thoughtful (they made it a very special stay for our honeymoon)! Special thanks to Kushan and Robinson!

placeInfo: {'id': '28040522', 'name': 'Sunrise Pasikuda', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 65, 'locationString': 'Pasikuda, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.92555, 'longitude': 81.56233, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g24914478-d28040522-Reviews-Sunrise_Pasikuda-Pasikuda_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://sunrisehotels.lk/', 'address': 'Coconut Development Board Road, Pasikuda 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Development Board Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pasikuda', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 62}}
text: Avoid! I don't usually write reviews but this is the WORST experience I have had in my life. The rooms are not safe! A lamp has electrified me the very first night. On the second day the installed hair drier caused a short circuit. For compensation they offered a "lunch" that consised of cold inedible "burger". Drinks not included. The staff does not speak English and the managers are smiling (as everyone in this country) but not kind at all. The food tastes terrible and the small selection does not satisfy the basic needs. Even though the rooms are nice and wide the floor is full of sand. The pool has oil and grass on the top due to lawn mowing. Animals are using the pool for bathing and ravens steal the food from people's plates in the restaurant. The musicians who play here at night are unique. Let's put it this way: you would pay them just to stop playing. The beach is sandy and beautiful, the sea is clean and warm. It's a pity such a terrible hotel was put on this heavenly location.
title: AVOID! Worst experience of my life

text: This was already our second time staying at this lovely hotel. First of all, all the staff are wonderful and extremely helpful - especially the luggage boys and the restaurant staff. text: The Amethyst resort hotel is extremely welcoming, all staff are super helpful and friendly, and offer excellent service but a special mention must go to Hanantha and his restaurant team. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean with a fridge and safe, a huge en suite shower room and private terrace. The restaurant serves very tasty food with a good range of options in the buffet breakfast and an al a carte menu available for lunch and dinner in the main restaurant or beach bar. Apparently there is no driver accommodation which is not ideal but otherwise this place is very good and beautifully located on the beach front.
title: Highly recommended (although note no driver accommodation)

roomTip: Dinner at 730 pm
text: The beds were so comfy and the pillows too.  Nice hot fast showers, fridge for your water, wifi and movies to watch on tv.  Step out onto  the most pristine part of the beach or swim in the big, clean pool.  Interesting sites just outside the resort and an atm only 500m away.  Best thing was the staff would do anything for you, getting a mattress for your poolside bed, helping to use the tv, getting us plenty of water, turning on the spa just for you, beautifully done laundry and fast.  Housekeeping, gardeners, grounds people, management answer your needs immediately!  And the food, many courses, lovely pasta mains and the curries, oh!  Pleasant layout of the resort.  Much fun, great memories made, will come back.  Must mention the supervisor Samanthe, who checked in on us, gave us some history and conversation and really made sure all our needs were met.
title: Different and fun

text:
Great location right by the beach with its own sunbeds for hotel guests. Very nice, large and clean pool. The room is large and clean with a very good bed and good pillows and also has a terrace. The outdoor area at the hotel is also well-kept. 
The only downside is the restaurant and the food. It is not a pleasant room, but on the other hand, the staff here are very attentive and want to do the very best they can to ensure that the guests are satisfied.
If I ever come back to Passikudha I will stay here again 👍
title: Good choice for a nice stay

roomTip: Need more outdoor activities....
text:
Hi,  I travelled with my family all the way from Negombo... 
The Hotel was conveniently located and is easily found and its beautiful ... 
We got a sea view room  and its spaciaus  makes movement within the room very comfortable. Bathroom and rooms are clean dispite its a beach hotel.  Our stay was very enjoyable. 
 
We found the Reception Staff  very friendly, fast and obliging. We were very happy to be given an early checkin because we travelled non stop 5hours  after our  request. 

We are pleased with the hotel accommodations, as they are generally clean, tastefully furnished and well maintained.
 Friendly, accommodating staff, willing to help with a smile. I must mention guy,  William from reception. 
 Facilities, swimming pool were clean. 
 Food and FB team make sure to take care of us.. Especially restaurant Supervisor Samantha weerasooriya. My daughter is little picky eater. He make sure she has been taken care of. 

We would like to express our sincere appreciation for the quality of service by Samantha. He is very professional...  

Buffet was good.. Food were yummy and had combination of western, indian and srilankan. 
 The dining area is spacious, well lit and hygienic. Most importantly, we are delighted by the readiness and the responsiveness of your staffs. They are always willing to accommodate whatever request we put forward. Such positive service attitude is highly commendable.

The beach is very safe and we spent lots of time in the beach until midnight. 

We greatly appreciate the hospitality and excellent service accorded to us by all staff of Amethyst Passikuda...

This is one of our best vaccation.. 

Thank you Amethyst... Definitely we will come back again...
title: Simply wow....

roomTip: Be aware there’s no where to eat or drink other than the hotel
text: The hotel is certainly large and spacious. We stayed for one night as we were travelling about the area.  The staff were friendly and helpful but we did have a few issues with our initial room, the AC wasn’t working and it took a while before they agreed to move us.  Once moved the new room was fine, nice large bathroom, good shower and comfortable bed.  We hadn’t opted for half board so found the restaurant a bit disappointing, especially as you have to pay quite a bit for a set meal which is just average. Sadly there doesn’t feel like there’s much of an atmosphere, no music or soft lighting in the bar or restaurant. Overall fine for one night but not sure I would be happy staying longer.
title: One night stay as travelling around the area

text:
We spent our holiday here in January. We travel all over the world and have a comparison of what it is like in other parts of the world.  A wonderful, cosy hotel.  
It was a fantastic time for us.  
We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.
Rooms large and beautiful. Very large bathroom. Cleaning service fantastic, at a very high level.
 Very clean in the rooms.  We had a terrace with a beautiful view of the garden and the river. In our opinion, the river is the asset of the hotel.
A wonderful garden where you can watch the animals and relax in nature. 
Peace, quiet and the sound of birds. 
On the other side of our apartment there was a large beautiful swimming pool and a wonderful large beach.
The surrounding area was beautiful.   Very good food and drinks. Delicious desserts. A big thank you to Hasith. A fantastic man. He was very friendly and committed to his duties. Always smiling and ready to help. Service of the highest standard. 
 A big thank you also to Samantha. He was always very smiling, engaged and helpful. He created a fantastic atmosphere during our stay.
A big congratulations to the hotel for the wonderful staff who organise a fantastic stay and atmosphere for guests.
We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel with all our hearts.
 Agnieszka (Agnes) and Piotr ( Peter) from Poland
title: amazing stay

roomTip: Amazing sandy beach and is very safe as well for all users.
text:
The Calm Pasi resort is a destination surrounded by lush green coconut trees around the garden and the breathtaking view of the magnificently amazing sandy beach of Pasikudha, the best view you can imagine starting from the hotel lobby or the main pool area and resort rooms. 

GM Sujeeva and the hotel team gave us a very warm welcome they made sure we were very comfortable at all times from day one at this lovely resort. We were given a garden-view pool access room for our two-night stay at Pasi. We were staying in an amazing pool access room the room was very well-presented very clean and we had all the required amenities in it for us. 

The entire hotel team were amazing supper friendly very polite very helpful and with an amazing pretty smile starting from the front office to the garden and team of the premises. This resort team is absolute **GEM **in my personal experience and my better half agreed 100% with me as well. 

F&B and Kitchen were amazing brilliant guy very professional in their job role very attention to detail. The best part of this young team is that they remember guest requirements very well even from their previous stay which is amazing to observe the way they look after their guest at Calm Pasi. They are super friendly very professional both in service very polite and very helpful as humans as I said the entire resort team absolute “” GEM”” 
Sujeeva and his entire management team are a super friendly and very professional bunch of individuals who will be at your service on the premises that you will come across during your stay.   When we requested a meal from the Ala Cart menu it was effortless for the resort team the Margherita/Veg. the pizza we selected and prepared by the hotel was mouthwatering and amazingly very tasty standards above other pizza outlets we have experienced in Ceylon.  It was very warm and extremely crispy when served to the table during our stay. The food served at the restaurant was an amazing choice given to us as well. 

You must also try the resort Signature Ceylon (The Yara Tea special) on offer I must say the best-made Ceylon traditional style tea I have ever tasted is available here. The fresh juice welcome drinks wow it’s amazing and freshly prepared and served. 
The Public area facilities for guest use are kept very well clean and in good hygiene levels. The  Restaurant and buffet service area are in great shape and good atmosphere, good vibe is seen in the restaurant during meal times. The food is fantastic and presented in a very hygienic manner to guests. 

Meet and greet with the lovely word “” Ayu - Bowan “” ( which means wish you a long life in Sinhalese) done in a very friendly and polite manner by all staff of the hotel at any given time which is quite amazing to observe. Another great experience at Calm Pasi.
 Kudos to the entire resort team of Calm Pasi. Keep up the good work guys. 
See you all again one day. Thank you so much for your hospitality.
title: Returning to Calm Resort of Pasikudha beach

text:
Excellent choice at Pasikuda. The hotel is right at the famous pristine shallow beach of Pasikuda. 

The hotel is well equipped with a gym and a pool. 

Food was good. The staff was quite courteous. 

The kids club however is rudimentary. 

Few religious guests were in non-swimming attire in the pool, which I found disgusting.  Those guests were rude to the pool attendant when he pointed it out. An ideal solution would be for the hotel to provide them with appropriate modest swimwear either for sale or rent. This would generate some extra income to the hotel as well.
title: Excellent choice in the East

text:
We had a truly relaxing stay at Calm Resort & Spa in Kalkuda. Our Calm Suite was spacious and beautifully appointed, offering stunning sea views. The F&B team, led by the exceptional Mr. Pramod, provided impeccable service.

We took advantage of the location and enjoyed snorkeling at Pasi Reef. Our two-day visit in September was a perfect blend of tranquility and adventure. Highly recommend!
title: A Serene Escape

placeInfo: {'id': '8318744', 'name': 'The Calm Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1063, 'locationString': 'Kalkudah, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.928913, 'longitude': 81.56031, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2193270-d8318744-Reviews-The_Calm_Resort_Spa-Kalkudah_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.brownshotels.com/calmpasikuda/', 'address': 'Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Cultivation Board Road', 'street2': 'Pasikuda', 'city': 'Kalkudah', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 26, 'count2': 26, 'count3': 45, 'count4': 169, 'count5': 797}}
text:
While the hotel is large and the access to the beach was enjoyable, we did have some issues with this hotel. First and foremost, the AC could not be controlled by the remote, not even to change temperature or switch on or off. I did ask for assistance, and asked if maybe the batteries need to be changed, so I asked for new batteries. I was uncomfortable then when 3 young men showed up, to a room where 2 women were staying. I felt uncomfortable and didn't let them inside when they asked me if I needed help to "change the batteries". 

The dinner buffet had a lack of food diversity and selection, and the pool bar kept forgetting our orders for food and drink. 

Finally, during one of the dinners I was not feeling well, and when I said I didn't want a drink with my dinner the waiter laughed in my face. 

I had much better stays during my time in Sri Lanka, so come here if you like to have a nice beach access, but keep expectations low.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo: {'id': '8318744', 'name': 'The Calm Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1063, 'locationString': 'Kalkudah, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 7.928913, 'longitude': 81.56031, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2193270-d8318744-Reviews-The_Calm_Resort_Spa-Kalkudah_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.brownshotels.com/calmpasikuda/', 'address': 'Coconut Cultivation Board Road Pasikuda, Kalkudah 30410 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Coconut Cultivation Board Road', 'street2': 'Pasikuda', 'city': 'Kalkudah', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '30410'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 26, 'count2': 26, 'count3': 45, 'count4': 169, 'count5': 797}}
text:
I recently stayed at Calm Resort & Spa in Kalkuda, Sri Lanka, and it was an unforgettable experience. The resort's beachfront location, with its pristine sandy beach and crystal-clear waters, provided the perfect setting for relaxation. The stunning pool offered breathtaking ocean views and impeccable service.

Our room was a perfect blend of modern comfort and elegance, with mesmerizing beach and pool views through the window. The culinary experience was exceptional, featuring a diverse menu of local and international dishes, and the beachside bar served refreshing cocktails.

The staff epitomized hospitality, going above and beyond to make our stay memorable.

Calm Resort & Spa is a true gem on Sri Lanka's east coast, combining natural beauty, luxurious accommodations, delectable food, and outstanding service. We left feeling refreshed and look forward to our next visit. Highly recommended!
title: An Idyllic Paradise – Perfect Getaway at east coast

text: First of all i should mention about the location, when we go there after long journey they offered us a good welcome with a pleasant smile, after a quick checkin they directed us to our room, the room was well cleaned and attractive, we also had a beautiful ocean view from our balcony, it was really calm place as the hotel name, the beach was very clear and well cleaned, The food was very delicious and the Restaurant staff was very friendly, i should mention there was a boy at reception named Angelo helped us a lot and gave us every information about the hotel, we didn't had any trouble because he always talking with everyone with a pleasant smile and gave us a good service, That's a highly recommended place to visit and a safe and calm place to visit, Thank you everyone who helped us during the stay, and see you again
title: Great Environment, Great Staff, We've enjoyed a lot our holiday
